      details: |

        <p>A selectize list creates a way to select one or more items from a list.</p>

        <p>To use a selectize list that allows you to select _multiple_ items: </p>

        <ol>
          <li>
          Add `ui.input_selectize()` to the UI of your app to create a div in which to display the selectize list. Where you call this function will determine where the selectize list appears within the app's layout. 
          </li>
          <li>
          Specify the `id` and `label` parameters of `ui.input_selectize()` to define the identifier and label of the select list.
          </li>
          <li>
          Supply the `choices` parameter with either a list or dictionary of choices. If `choices` is a a list, its elements become the select list values and labels. If `choices` is a dictionary, `ui.input_selectize()` uses the dictionary keys as the list values and the dictionary values as the list labels. 
          
          You can also supply with `choices` a dictionary of dictionaries. `ui.input_selectize()` will use the top-level keys as group labels.
          </li>
          <li>
          The `multiple` parameter controls whether you can select multiple items at once. Set `multiple=True` to allow the user to select multiple values.
          </li>
        </ol>
        
        <p>To access the value of a selectize list:</p>
        
        <ol>
          <li>
          Use `input.<selectize_id>()` (e.g., `input.selectize()`) to access the selected value(s). The server value of a selectize list is a list of strings.
          </li>
        </ol>
